trans-unit.source: Create Data Source
trans-unit.target: Create Data Source

trans-unit.source: Create Data Source (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Create Data Source (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: You can create a new data source within an Azure Search service using an HTTP POST request.
trans-unit.target: You can create a new data source within an Azure Search service using an HTTP POST request.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use PUT and specify the data source name on the URI.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use PUT and specify the data source name on the URI.

trans-unit.source: If the data source does not exist, it will be created.
trans-unit.target: If the data source does not exist, it will be created.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of data sources allowed varies by pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of data sources allowed varies by pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: The free service allows up to 3 data sources.
trans-unit.target: The free service allows up to 3 data sources.

trans-unit.source: Standard service allows 50 data sources.
trans-unit.target: Standard service allows 50 data sources.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="a8b1e21e-7703-4718-8e29-c8825354b3ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limits and constraints (Azure Search)</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="a8b1e21e-7703-4718-8e29-c8825354b3ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limits and constraints (Azure Search)</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required for all service requests.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required for all service requests.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Create Data Source</languageKeyword> request can be constructed using either a POST or PUT method.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Create Data Source</languageKeyword> request can be constructed using either a POST or PUT method.

trans-unit.source: When using POST, you must provide a data source name in the request body along with the data source definition.
trans-unit.target: When using POST, you must provide a data source name in the request body along with the data source definition.

trans-unit.source: With PUT, the name is part of the URL.
trans-unit.target: With PUT, the name is part of the URL.

trans-unit.source: If the data source doesn't exist, it is created.
trans-unit.target: If the data source doesn't exist, it is created.

trans-unit.source: If it already exists, it is updated to the new definition
trans-unit.target: If it already exists, it is updated to the new definition

trans-unit.source: The data source name must be lower case, start with a letter or number, have no slashes or dots, and be less than 128 characters.
trans-unit.target: The data source name must be lower case, start with a letter or number, have no slashes or dots, and be less than 128 characters.

trans-unit.source: After starting the data source name with a letter or number, the rest of the name can include any letter, number and dashes, as long as the dashes are not consecutive.
trans-unit.target: After starting the data source name with a letter or number, the rest of the name can include any letter, number and dashes, as long as the dashes are not consecutive.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="36a5b042-285b-46d1-8065-9558e328967c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming Rules (Azure Search)</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="36a5b042-285b-46d1-8065-9558e328967c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming Rules (Azure Search)</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>api-version</languageKeyword> is required.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>api-version</languageKeyword> is required.

trans-unit.source: The current version is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The current version is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service Versioning</link> has details, including more information about alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service Versioning</link> has details, including more information about alternative versions.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: The following list describes the required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following list describes the required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Set this to <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: Set this to <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.

trans-unit.source: It is a string value, unique to your service.
trans-unit.target: It is a string value, unique to your service.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Create Data Source</languageKeyword> request must include an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Create Data Source</languageKeyword> request must include an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.
trans-unit.target: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.

trans-unit.source: You can get both the service name and <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> from your service dashboard in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure management portal</linkText><linkUri>https://portal.azure.com</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can get both the service name and <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> from your service dashboard in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure management portal</linkText><linkUri>https://portal.azure.com</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> for page navigation help.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> for page navigation help.

trans-unit.source: Request Body Syntax
trans-unit.target: Request Body Syntax

trans-unit.source: The body of the request contains a data source definition, which includes type of the data source, credentials to read the data, as well as an optional data change detection and data deletion detection policies that are used to efficiently identify changed or deleted data in the data source when used with a periodically scheduled indexer
trans-unit.target: The body of the request contains a data source definition, which includes type of the data source, credentials to read the data, as well as an optional data change detection and data deletion detection policies that are used to efficiently identify changed or deleted data in the data source when used with a periodically scheduled indexer

trans-unit.source: The syntax for structuring the request payload is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The syntax for structuring the request payload is as follows.

trans-unit.source: A sample request is provided further on in this topic.
trans-unit.target: A sample request is provided further on in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Request contains the following properties:
trans-unit.target: Request contains the following properties:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the data source.
trans-unit.target: The name of the data source.

trans-unit.source: A data source name must only contain lowercase letters, digits or dashes, cannot start or end with dashes and is limited to 128 characters.
trans-unit.target: A data source name must only contain lowercase letters, digits or dashes, cannot start or end with dashes and is limited to 128 characters.

trans-unit.source: An optional description.
trans-unit.target: An optional description.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Must be one of the supported data source types:
trans-unit.target: Must be one of the supported data source types:

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>azuresql</codeInline> for Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>azuresql</codeInline> for Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>documentdb</codeInline> for DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>documentdb</codeInline> for DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: The required <languageKeyword>connectionString</languageKeyword> property specifies the connection string for the data source.
trans-unit.target: The required <languageKeyword>connectionString</languageKeyword> property specifies the connection string for the data source.

trans-unit.source: The format of the connection string depends on the data source type:
trans-unit.target: The format of the connection string depends on the data source type:

trans-unit.source: For Azure SQL Database, this is the usual SQL Server connection string.
trans-unit.target: For Azure SQL Database, this is the usual SQL Server connection string.

trans-unit.source: If you're using Azure management portal to retrieve the connection string, use the <codeInline>ADO.NET connection string</codeInline> option.
trans-unit.target: If you're using Azure management portal to retrieve the connection string, use the <codeInline>ADO.NET connection string</codeInline> option.

trans-unit.source: For DocumentDB, the connection string must be in the following format: <codeInline>"AccountEndpoint=https://[your account name].documents.azure.com;AccountKey=[your account key];Database=[your database id]"</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For DocumentDB, the connection string must be in the following format: <codeInline>"AccountEndpoint=https://[your account name].documents.azure.com;AccountKey=[your account key];Database=[your database id]"</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: All of the values are required.
trans-unit.target: All of the values are required.

trans-unit.source: You can find them in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure management portal</linkText><linkUri>https://portal.azure.com</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can find them in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure management portal</linkText><linkUri>https://portal.azure.com</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The required <codeInline>name</codeInline> property specifies the table or view (for Azure SQL data source) or collection (for DocumentDB data source) that will be indexed.
trans-unit.target: The required <codeInline>name</codeInline> property specifies the table or view (for Azure SQL data source) or collection (for DocumentDB data source) that will be indexed.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB data sources also support an optional <languageKeyword>query</languageKeyword> property that allows you to specify a query that flattens an arbitrary JSON document layout into a flat schema that Azure Search can index.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB data sources also support an optional <languageKeyword>query</languageKeyword> property that allows you to specify a query that flattens an arbitrary JSON document layout into a flat schema that Azure Search can index.

trans-unit.source: The optional <languageKeyword>dataChangeDetectionPolicy</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>dataDeletionDetectionPolicy</languageKeyword> are described below.
trans-unit.target: The optional <languageKeyword>dataChangeDetectionPolicy</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>dataDeletionDetectionPolicy</languageKeyword> are described below.

trans-unit.source: Data Change Detection Policies
trans-unit.target: Data Change Detection Policies

trans-unit.source: The purpose of a data change detection policy is to efficiently identify changed data items.
trans-unit.target: The purpose of a data change detection policy is to efficiently identify changed data items.

trans-unit.source: Supported policies vary based on the data source type.
trans-unit.target: Supported policies vary based on the data source type.

trans-unit.source: Sections below describe each policy
trans-unit.target: Sections below describe each policy

trans-unit.source: You can switch data detection policies after the indexer is already created, using <link xlink:href="e36fa72a-a924-4e19-b7da-cd8f132c8963" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Reset Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can switch data detection policies after the indexer is already created, using <link xlink:href="e36fa72a-a924-4e19-b7da-cd8f132c8963" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Reset Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: High Watermark Change Detection Policy
trans-unit.target: High Watermark Change Detection Policy

trans-unit.source: Use this policy when your data source contains a column or property that meets the following criteria:
trans-unit.target: Use this policy when your data source contains a column or property that meets the following criteria:

trans-unit.source: All inserts specify a value for the column.
trans-unit.target: All inserts specify a value for the column.

trans-unit.source: All updates to an item also change the value of the column.
trans-unit.target: All updates to an item also change the value of the column.

trans-unit.source: The value of this column increases with each change.
trans-unit.target: The value of this column increases with each change.

trans-unit.source: Queries that use a filter clause similar to the following <codeInline>WHERE [High Water Mark Column] %%amp;gt; [Current High Water Mark Value]</codeInline> can be executed efficiently.
trans-unit.target: Queries that use a filter clause similar to the following <codeInline>WHERE [High Water Mark Column] %%amp;gt; [Current High Water Mark Value]</codeInline> can be executed efficiently.

trans-unit.source: For example, when using Azure SQL data sources, an indexed <codeInline>rowversion</codeInline> column is the ideal candidate for use with with the high water mark policy.
trans-unit.target: For example, when using Azure SQL data sources, an indexed <codeInline>rowversion</codeInline> column is the ideal candidate for use with with the high water mark policy.

trans-unit.source: When using DocumentDB data sources, you must use the <codeInline>_ts</codeInline> property provided by DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: When using DocumentDB data sources, you must use the <codeInline>_ts</codeInline> property provided by DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be specified as follows:
trans-unit.target: This policy can be specified as follows:

trans-unit.source: SQL Integrated Change Detection Policy
trans-unit.target: SQL Integrated Change Detection Policy

trans-unit.source: If your SQL Server relational database supports <externalLink><linkText>change tracking</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb933875.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, we recommend using SQL Integrated Change Tracking Policy.
trans-unit.target: If your SQL Server relational database supports <externalLink><linkText>change tracking</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb933875.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, we recommend using SQL Integrated Change Tracking Policy.

trans-unit.source: This policy enables the most efficient change tracking, and allows Azure Search to identify deleted rows without you having to have an explicit "soft delete" column in your schema.
trans-unit.target: This policy enables the most efficient change tracking, and allows Azure Search to identify deleted rows without you having to have an explicit "soft delete" column in your schema.

trans-unit.source: Integrated change tracking is supported starting with the following SQL Server database versions:
trans-unit.target: Integrated change tracking is supported starting with the following SQL Server database versions:

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2008 R2, if you're using SQL Server on Azure VMs.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2008 R2, if you're using SQL Server on Azure VMs.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database V12, if you're using Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database V12, if you're using Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: When using SQL Integrated Change Tracking policy, do not specify a separate data deletion detection policy - this policy has built-in support for identifying deleted rows.
trans-unit.target: When using SQL Integrated Change Tracking policy, do not specify a separate data deletion detection policy - this policy has built-in support for identifying deleted rows.

trans-unit.source: This policy can only be used with tables; it cannot be used with views.
trans-unit.target: This policy can only be used with tables; it cannot be used with views.

trans-unit.source: You need to enable change tracking for the table you're using before you can use this policy.
trans-unit.target: You need to enable change tracking for the table you're using before you can use this policy.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Enable and disable change tracking</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb964713.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> for instructions.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Enable and disable change tracking</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb964713.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> for instructions.

trans-unit.source: When structuring the <languageKeyword>Create Data Source</languageKeyword> request, SQL integrated change tracking policy can be specified as follows:
trans-unit.target: When structuring the <languageKeyword>Create Data Source</languageKeyword> request, SQL integrated change tracking policy can be specified as follows:

trans-unit.source: Data Deletion Detection Policies
trans-unit.target: Data Deletion Detection Policies

trans-unit.source: The purpose of a data deletion detection policy is to efficiently identify deleted data items.
trans-unit.target: The purpose of a data deletion detection policy is to efficiently identify deleted data items.

trans-unit.source: Currently, the only supported policy is the <languageKeyword>Soft Delete</languageKeyword> policy, which allows identifying deleted items based on the value of a 'soft delete' column or property in the data source.
trans-unit.target: Currently, the only supported policy is the <languageKeyword>Soft Delete</languageKeyword> policy, which allows identifying deleted items based on the value of a 'soft delete' column or property in the data source.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be specified as follows:
trans-unit.target: This policy can be specified as follows:

trans-unit.source: Only columns with string, integer, or boolean values are supported.
trans-unit.target: Only columns with string, integer, or boolean values are supported.

trans-unit.source: The value used as <languageKeyword>softDeleteMarkerValue</languageKeyword> must be a string, even if the corresponding column holds integers or booleans.
trans-unit.target: The value used as <languageKeyword>softDeleteMarkerValue</languageKeyword> must be a string, even if the corresponding column holds integers or booleans.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the value that appears in your data source is 1, use <userInputLocalizable>"1"</userInputLocalizable> as the <languageKeyword>softDeleteMarkerValue</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the value that appears in your data source is 1, use <userInputLocalizable>"1"</userInputLocalizable> as the <languageKeyword>softDeleteMarkerValue</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Request Body Examples
trans-unit.target: Request Body Examples

trans-unit.source: If you intend to use the data source with an indexer that runs on a schedule, this example shows how to specify change and deletion detection policies:
trans-unit.target: If you intend to use the data source with an indexer that runs on a schedule, this example shows how to specify change and deletion detection policies:

trans-unit.source: If you only intend to use the data source for one-time copy of the data, the policies can be omitted:
trans-unit.target: If you only intend to use the data source for one-time copy of the data, the policies can be omitted:

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: For a successful request: 201 Created.
trans-unit.target: For a successful request: 201 Created.
